author: Ashleigh Fields
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) on Saturday signed a first of its kind bill banning Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents from wearing masks while conducting operations in the state of California.  Newsom said ICE agents would no longer be “hidden from accountability” arguing masks prevent “transparency” for citizens and hinder “oversight.”  “That’s Trump’s America...
title: Newsom signs legislation banning ICE agents from wearing masks in California

author: Ian Swanson
description: President Trump on Saturday threatened the Taliban government of Afghanistan, saying “bad things are going to happen” if it does not give Bagram Air Base back to the United States. “If Afghanistan doesn’t give Bagram Airbase back to those that built it, the United States of America, BAD THINGS ARE GOING TO HAPPEN!!!,” Trump wrote...
title: Trump warns Afghanistan of 'bad things' if Bagram Air Base not returned to US

author: Ian Swanson
description: Ty Cobb, who once served as a lawyer to President Trump during his first term, offered stark criticism of the administration’s involvement in the suspension by ABC of late-night host Jimmy Kimmel. Cobb said the pressure the Federal Communications Commission and the Trump administration put on ABC was comparable to what happens in Russia or...
title: Ty Cobb says Trump ‘waging war on people who offend him’ after Kimmel suspension

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The White House is seeking to explain a new $100,000 fee for new H-1B visas that was announced on Friday by President Trump at a press event. The decision has unnerved H-1B visa holders and companies that sponsor H-1B visa holders, as it would significantly raise the cost of such a visa if the policy...
title: White House seeks to explain Trump’s $100K H-1B visa

author: Alex Gangitano
description: The Trump administration is aiming to use any levers of power it has to respond to Charlie Kirk’s killing, in part to send a message to political opponents. ABC taking comedian Jimmy Kimmel off the air for his comments on Kirk this week is just one major highlight of the administration’s enormous pressure on ideological...
title: Trump uses levers of power to respond to Charlie Kirk killing

author: Filip Timotija
description: An armed man who was detained on Friday at the memorial venue in Arizona for the late conservative activist Charlie Kirk was charged on Saturday with impersonating a law enforcement officer.  Authorities identified the man as Joshua Runkles, 42, who was taken into custody at the State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Ariz., after “exhibiting suspicious...
title: Man detained in Kirk memorial venue charged with impersonating officer

author: Filip Timotija
description: Conservative influencer James O’Keefe pushed back Saturday on the Pentagon’s new press restrictions on reporters covering the Defense Department (DOD), saying the U.S. government “should not be asking us to obey.” “We should NOT be cheerleading this. The Supreme Court permits journalists to lawfully acquire info about a matter of public concern, (even [if] a...
title: O'Keefe pushes back on Pentagon press restrictions

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Former Rep. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.) on Friday rebuked Federal Communications Commission (FCC) Chair Brendan Carr for backing ABC's suspension of comedian Jimmy Kimmel. Cheney, a vocal critic of the Trump administration who left office in 2023, pointed to the FCC chair's comments before Kimmel's suspension this week in which he called for ABC to "take...
title: Cheney slams FCC chief after Kimmel suspension: 'You took an oath to the Constitution'

author: Lawerence R. Jacobs, opinion contributor
description: The Supreme Court is expected to issue a ruling in the coming months that limits Donald Trump's power, and if he defies the court, the consequences could be drastic, including a constitutional crisis and a sell-off in the stock market.
title: The costs of Trump defying the Supreme Court

author: Tobias Peter, opinion contributor
description: The ROAD to Housing Act of 2025 is a progressive housing agenda in bipartisan packaging that runs counter to Republican priorities and risks cementing a new generation of permanent renters.
title: The ROAD to Housing Act is a dead end for Republicans

author: Filip Timotija
description: Federal law enforcement officers and protestors opposing the Trump administration's ramped up immigration enforcement in Chicago clashed Friday near the Windy City. Some of the demonstrators made attempts to prevent government vehicles from departing a detention facility in Broadview, Ill., where migrants are held for processing. Federal agents responded by firing pepper balls and tear...
title: Federal officers, anti-ICE protestors clash in Chicago: What to know

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) and House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries (N.Y.) sent a letter to President Trump Saturday to demand a meeting to discuss the expiration of government funding on Sept. 30, which could result in a shutdown. Alarms are flashing on Capitol Hill after the Senate rejected a seven-week continuing resolution (CR)...
title: Schumer, Jeffries demand meeting with Trump to avoid government shutdown

author: Brian Simboli, opinion contributor
description: At an August meeting with South Korea’s president, Trump again expressed his vision for drawing down U.S., China and Russia nuclear stockpiles. A few days later, the Chinese foreign ministry balked at this goal. Trump reportedly has been talking to China about the TikTok deal; perhaps this openness to talks can eventually lead to serious denuclearization talks. As...
title: The window for US-China nuclear weapons negotiations is shrinking

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Graphic videos of Charlie Kirk’s assassination spread like weeds over social media last week in a way that it made it difficult for the youngest online to avoid the bloodshed.  From autoplay on X to friends sharing the footage in group chats, both young people who loved and hated the conservative leader saw the videos...
title: Charlie Kirk assassination videos leave fallout for schools, parents

author: Douglas MacKinnon, opinion contributor
description: Our nation is teetering on a razor’s edge. Hate and the celebration of the ugliness it spawns placed it there. Only calm, rational and unifying voices can save us now.
title: The glorification of assassination in America must end — before it’s too late

author: Tom Little, opinion contributor
description: Without a federal call to action, we are destined to continue the current cycle of economy-draining disaster and recovery in which our nation is currently entrenched.
title: Flooding is a major danger — treat it as a US national security threat

author: Filip Timotija
description: Comedian Bill Maher hammered President Trump and the right for their “hypocritical” criticism of Jimmy Kimmel, who was taken off air this week by ABC, vowing that he is “not intimidated.”  “I know why you’re happy tonight. I’m still on," the "Real Time" host said Friday during a monologue on his show. "Oh, my God....
title: Maher hammers Trump, GOP over 'hypocritical' Kimmel criticism: 'I am not intimidated'

author: Jonathan Turley, opinion contributor
description: Politicians who fought for censorship are now making the very arguments they ridiculed just months ago.
title: The funniest joke Jimmy Kimmel never told

author: Nick Jachim
description: How much money you bring in varies drastically depending on where you live in the U.S., and while the cost of living continues to rise across the country, the amount of income being earned nationwide is slowly rising as well.
title: These US cities are making more money than last year, says new report

author: Johan Sheridan
description: The National Labor Relations Board has filed a lawsuit against New York State, alleging that a new state law regulating private sector labor relations usurps the NLRB's authority and is preempted by the National Labor Relations Act.
title: National Labor Relations Board sues to block New York labor law

author: Justin Leventhal, opinion contributor
description: If bettors feel squeezed by bad odds, fees and disappearing perks they may return to the unregulated platforms that are not burdened by punitive regulations.
title: High taxes are rigging online sports betting against consumers

author: Filip Timotija
description: A man claiming to be a member of law enforcement was detained at an Arizona stadium where the memorial for Charlie Kirk, the conservative activist who was shot and killed last week, is set to take place Sunday. Local police and the U.S. Secret Service are investigating the armed man, who was "exhibiting suspicious behavior”...
title: Armed man claiming to be law enforcement detained outside Charlie Kirk Memorial site

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump pushed back on reports that Erik Siebert, the U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia, resigned from his post, claiming, “he didn’t quit, I fired him!”  “Today I withdrew the Nomination of Erik Siebert as U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia, when I was informed that he received the UNUSUALLY...
title: Trump refutes claim US attorney in Virginia resigned: 'He didn't quit, I fired him!'

author: Filip Timotija
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he plans to meet again with President Trump on the sidelines of the United Nations (UN) General Assembly next week, as Russian strikes against Ukraine continue despite pressure on the Kremlin to come to a peace deal. The two leaders will discuss security guarantees, backed by both Kyiv and its...
title: Zelensky plans to meet with Trump on sidelines of UN assembly as Russian strikes persist

author: Sean Noone
description: The American Cancer Society estimates that in 2025 there have been about 107,320 new cases of colon cancer and 46,950 new cases of rectal cancer.
title: Study: Aspirin cuts colorectal cancer recurrence in half

author: Brett Samuels
description: The Trump administration’s pressure campaign against ABC and Jimmy Kimmel, which saw the Federal Communications Commission chief turn up the heat on broadcasters, is intensifying fears over the policing of speech — which were already rising before this week’s late night television uproar. Kimmel’s fate was up in the air Friday evening after he was...
title: Free speech storm intensifies as Trump goes after Kimmel

author: Emily Brooks
description: The four Republicans who voted with Democrats against reprimanding Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.) over comments about Charlie Kirk are getting excoriated by the online right — with Rep. Nancy Mace (R-S.C.), who prompted the vote on the Omar censure, leading the charge against Rep. Cory Mills (R-Fla.) in particular. The four — Reps. Mike Flood...
title: Republicans grapple with backlash over tabling Omar censure brought by Mace

author: Laura Kelly
description: European countries are taking steps to sanction oil infrastructure in China but are unlikely to impose tariffs on Beijing, a step President Trump has set out as a prerequisite of sorts for the U.S. to impose tougher sanctions on Russia. Trump in a Truth Social post this week said he was “ready to do major Sanctions...
title: Trump faces challenge in convincing Europe to hit China over Russia

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Four lawmakers bucked their party in Friday's votes on a Republican stopgap bill to fund the government, which passed the House but was blocked by Democrats in the Senate. House Reps. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) and Victoria Spartz (R-Ind.) were the only GOP no votes in the House, while Rep. Jared Golden (D-Maine) was the sole...
title: These four lawmakers bucked their party on stopgap spending bill

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump said on Friday that he ordered another strike on a ship in the Caribbean allegedly transporting narcotics, the third such attack this month. "On my Orders, the Secretary of War ordered a lethal kinetic strike on a vessel affiliated with a Designated Terrorist Organization conducting narcotrafficking in the USSOUTHCOM area of responsibility," Trump...
title: Trump says third strike launched on alleged narcotrafficking boat

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Stephen Miran, President Trump's newly confirmed pick to the Federal Reserve board, said on Friday that uncertainty around U.S. trade policies was partly responsible for slow economic growth this year. Miran, who was confirmed on Wednesday in time to join the Fed meeting Thursday, said growth in the first half of the year was “weaker...
title: Trump's new Fed pick says growth slowed 'in part' by trade uncertainty

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Erik Siebert, U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia, resigned on Friday amid pressure from the Trump administration to launch an investigation into New York Attorney General Letitia James for alleged mortgage fraud. Siebert will be replaced by a new appointee, two sources familiar with the matter told The Associated Press. The New York...
title: US attorney in Virginia resigns amid pressure from Trump administration
